sentences.sentence: The Leopard( 豹 ) and the Fox( 狐狸 )
An old leopard( 豹 ), no longer able to chase( 追赶 ) animals, pretended( 假装 ) to be sick.
He said he would give great favors to any animal that would cure( 治愈 ) him.
A fox( 狐狸 ) heard this.
He made himself look like a doctor and went to visit the leopard( 豹 ).
Seeing him, the leopard( 豹 ) said that such a professional( 专业的 )- looking animal could not fail to( 未能 ) cure( 治愈 ) him.
This made the fox( 狐狸 ) happy, and he moved closer.
However, the leopard( 豹 ) caught him at once, for he was unable to run with the costume( 服装 ) tying up( 限制 )  his feet.
MORAL: Flattery( 阿谀奉承 ) is a dangerous weapon( 武器 ) in the hands of an enemy.
The Lion and a Donkey( 驴 )
The donkey( 驴 ) is not a very clever animal—
indeed, one of them was so stupid that he went up to a lion and challenged( 向...挑战 ) him to a fight.
The lion was just about to accept when he realized that he would look ridiculous( 可笑的 ) fighting with a donkey( 驴 ), even if he won.
So he said to the donkey( 驴 ), “Go away and live in peace—but know that you owe your life not to( 把...归功于 ) your strength, but to your foolishness( 愚蠢 ).”
MORAL: Some people are not even worth fighting with.
The Lion and the Fox( 狐狸 )
A fox( 狐狸 ) became partners( 搭档 ) with a lion.
Each had their own duties according to( 根据 ) their own natural abilities.
The fox( 狐狸 ) found the animals for the lion to catch.
The fox( 狐狸 ) soon became jealous( 嫉妒的 ) of the lion eating a bigger share.
He said that he would no longer find animals for the lion, but would catch them himself.
The next day he tried to catch a lamb( 羊羔 ), but was killed by the owner and his dogs.
MORAL: Don’t bite off more than you can chew( 咀嚼 ).
The Lion and the Mouse
A lion was woken by a mouse running over his face.
Angrily, he caught the mouse and was about to kill him,
when the mouse, afraid to die, said,
“If you could just spare my life, I will be sure to repay( 回报 ) your kindness.”
The lion laughed at( 嘲笑 ) the ridiculous( 愚蠢的 ) mouse who thought he could help a lion, but let him go anyway.
Shortly after this, the lion was caught by some hunters( 猎人 ), who tied him with strong ropes.
The mouse, hearing him roar( 咆哮 ), came up and chewed through( 咬断 ) the rope with his teeth, and set him free.
He then said, “You laughed at( 嘲笑 ) the idea of me ever being able to help you, and didn’t expect me to repay( 回报 ) you.
Now you know that it is possible for even a mouse to help a lion.”
MORAL: Today’s good deeds( 行为 ) are the seeds( 种子 ) of tomorrow’s blessings.
The Lion and the Three Bulls( 公牛 )
Three bulls( 公牛 ) were eating grass in a field, and were watched by a lion, who wanted to catch and eat them,
but who felt that it was too dangerous so long as they kept together.
So he began to create jealousy( 妒忌 ) and distrust( 不信任 ) among them by false( 伪造的 ) whispers( 谣言 ).
This plan succeeded so well that before long the bulls( 公牛 ) grew cold and unfriendly,
and finally avoided each other and fed( 喂养 ) each one on his own.
The lion had no sooner seen this than he attacked them and killed them, one by one.
MORAL: The quarrels( 争执 ) of friends are the opportunities of their enemies.

question.cn: 在故事The Leopard and the Fox中，狐狸进入豹子的洞穴后发生了什么？
question.en: In the story of the Leopard and the Fox, what happened to the fox after he entered the leopard's cave?

options.en: He was caught by the leopard.

analysis: 文中提到：“However, the leopard caught him at once, for he was unable to run with the costume tying up his feet.”由此可知，最后狐狸被装病的豹子抓起来了，因此选B。

question.cn: 在The Lion and a Donkey这个故事中，狮子同意和驴打架了吗？
question.en: In the story the Lion and a Donkey, did the lion agree to fight with the donkey?

analysis: 文中提到：“The lion was just about to accept when he realized that he would look ridiculous fighting with a donkey, even if he won.”狮子认识到即使他赢了，和驴打架也看起来很荒谬，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Lion and the Fox中，狐狸决定自己去打猎之后发生了什么？
question.en: In the story the Lion and the Fox, what happened to the fox after he decided to hunt alone?

options.en: He was killed by the lion.

options.cn: 他被牧民和他的狗杀死了。
options.en: He was killed by the owner of a lamb and his dogs.

analysis: 原文提到：“The next day he tried to catch a lamb, but was killed by the owner and his dogs.”可知，狐狸最后被牧民和他的狗杀死了，因此选C。

question.cn: 在故事The Lion and the Mouse中，狮子有没有杀死老鼠？
question.en: In the story the Lion and the Mouse, did the lion kill the mouse?

analysis: 文中提到：“The lion laughed at the ridiculous mouse who thought he could help a lion, but let him go anyway.”狮子虽然嘲笑了老鼠，但是仍然把老鼠放了，因此选B。

question.cn: 在The Lion and the Three Bulls故事中，一开始狮子为什么不能杀死公牛？
question.en: In the story the Lion and the Three Bulls, why couldn't the lion kill the bulls at first?

analysis: 文中提到：“It was too dangerous so long as they kept together.”因此选B。
